meanings.definition: A person who manages or looks after something.
meanings.sent1: The zoo's animal keepers ensure the animals are well cared for.
meanings.sent2: The library keepers organize and maintain the books on the shelves.
meanings.sent3: The diligent keepers always keep a watchful eye on the valuable artifacts.
meanings.sent4: She was the keeper of the family's traditions, passing them down through generations.
meanings.sent5: The garden keeper tended to the plants with great care, ensuring they thrived.

meanings.definition: A person who is responsible for taking care of animals.
meanings.sent1: The zoo keepers feed and clean the animals daily.
meanings.sent2: The animal keepers at the sanctuary provide a safe environment for the rescued animals.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy thought the keeper was a new friend to play with.
meanings.sent4: The keeper gently brushed the horse's mane, soothing the animal.
meanings.sent5: The young keeper eagerly learned how to care for the injured birds.

meanings.definition: A person who is in charge of a sports team.
meanings.sent1: The soccer team's keeper made crucial decisions during the game.
meanings.sent2: The coach and team keeper motivated the players to give their best.
meanings.sent3: The keeper's loud whistle signaled the end of the practice match.
meanings.sent4: The team keeper guided the players to work together as a cohesive unit.
meanings.sent5: The experienced keeper shared valuable strategies with the team for success.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that holds something in place.
meanings.sent1: The door keeper kept the entrance secure.
meanings.sent2: The lock and key are essential keepers for the safe.
meanings.sent3: The gate keeper prevented unauthorized entry into the castle.
meanings.sent4: The bookshelf keeper held the books neatly in place.
meanings.sent5: The carabiner acted as a reliable keeper for the climber's safety gear.

meanings.definition: A person who prevents something from being lost or stolen.
meanings.sent1: The security guard acted as a keeper of the valuable jewels.
meanings.sent2: The vigilant keeper ensured no items went missing from the museum.
meanings.sent3: The keeper of the keys made sure all doors were securely locked.
meanings.sent4: The watchful keeper spotted the thief trying to steal the painting.
meanings.sent5: The diligent keeper kept a close eye on the precious artifacts in the exhibit.
